meanings.sent1: The cake was easily divisibly into equal slices for everyone at the party.
meanings.sent2: The toy was designed to be divisibly assembled by children without any help.
meanings.sent3: The magician's hat seemed divisibly small, but he managed to pull out a giant rabbit from it!
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt divisibly torn between two different paths in life.
meanings.sent5: The puzzle pieces fit together so divisibly that completing it was a breeze.

meanings.definition: In a way that can be separated into parts.
meanings.sent1: The fabric tore divisibly along the seam, making it easy to mend.
meanings.sent2: She cut the paper divisibly, ensuring each piece was the same size.
meanings.sent3: The students worked divisibly on the group project, each focusing on their assigned section.
meanings.sent4: The music notes flowed divisibly, creating a harmonious melody.
meanings.sent5: The river split divisibly into smaller streams as it meandered through the valley.

meanings.definition: Able to be split into smaller parts.
meanings.sent1: The divisibly chocolate bar was perfect for sharing among friends.
meanings.sent2: The book had divisibly chapters, making it easy to read a little each night.
meanings.sent3: The cake looked divisibly delicious, with each layer offering a different flavor.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were divisibly organized, allowing her to focus on one task at a time.
meanings.sent5: The tree's branches spread divisibly, providing shade to all underneath.
